title: Time Periods
description: The time period(s) to which the data refer, regardless of when the data were collected.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date for the time period the data refer to, formatted as YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD, with no spaces in date expressions.

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end date for the time period the data refer to, formatted as YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD, with no spaces in date expressions.

time_frame.title: Time Frame
time_frame.description: An optional free-text description of the time period, used for non-numeric dates (e.g., 'Fall 2012') or to add context when multiple dates are present.
time_frame.usageNotes: The Time Frame should not simply restate the date(s) in words. For example, if the Time Period starts in 2020-01, the Time Frame should repeat 'January 2020'.
